column5: Working on a new minnow bait. 1.5" long
Nice looking lure there Brian. You got some kind of talent in your hands for detail work. Art
Gorgeously looking, cannot imagine how good it will be in the water.
How about one where the eye of the hook comes out behind the head to keep it level.
Wrapped the front of the shank with 8 wraps of .020 lead free wire to get a balance .

Thanks Lew  Truth be told,you tube is my friend. There are so many great tiers on there. They are from all over the world. Great thing is,they all have their own ties and takes on other flys.  Like I have said before,I am not one to get into the fancy competition fly ties. I see something that will work here,I will try them. Funny how some of the simplest ties,are so effective here.
Perch killer…..  if your selling, I’m buying.  Let me know!
Thanks pal  I was thinking, maybe a brown would take them in that local pool.  As far as selling, will let you know.

Brian great looking fly! Question when you tie are you following an established pattern and making personal tweaks or do you just make them based on matching the hatch? I don’t know much about flies or fly tying but it’s really an interesting hobby cheers Andrew

Thanks Andrew  Like I mentioned,I follow a pattern that will work in the waters of my area, but there are many different color patterns I can tie. The pin head will match a shiner here on lake Simcoe. It will also match lake Erie shiners. I have sold my ice bugs to guys that fish Erie,as they work what we use on Simcoe .
Brian, you certainly are a fly tying artist. Looks fantastic.
If the weather forecast holds correct, I.ll be setting them under a float on the river in frog water.
